_exec_summary.SummaryText: ookings Decanting Station has prepared this report to offer the public insights into our operations at this facility. We have confidence that the numerous safety measures we have implemented, coupled with our commitment to continuous improvement, make it highly unlikely for any incident to impact our employees or the surrounding area.

gs Decanting Station has a hot work permit that requires issuance of a hot work permit for hot work operations conducted on or near the covered process. 

Contractor Safety Program [40 CFR Part 68.87] 
Certarus Brookings Decanting Station has a contractor program in place in the event that they hire contractors to complete any specialized work in the covered process. Prior to selecting a contractor, a thorough evaluation of the contractor's safety performance is carried out. Certarus Brookings Decanting Station has a strict policy of informing the contractors of known potential hazards associated with the contractor's work and the corresponding processes. Contractors are also informed of all the procedures for emergency response in the event of an accidental release of a regulated substance.

The five-year accident history [40 CFR 68.155(d)]:
The facilitys RMP process is new and therefore have had no accidents.

The emergency response program [40 CFR 68.155(e)]:
In the event of an incident, Certarus Brookings Decanting Station has systems in place to respond quickly. Processes can be shut down on an emergency basis and the facility has a plan in place for evacuations, adequate first aid, and medical treatment and notification of local emergency response agencies. The facility is a non-responding facility, and relies on the Hamlin County LEPC to respond to chemical releases.

Planned changes to improve safety [40 CFR 68.155(f)]:
Certarus Brookings Decanting Station continually strives to improve its safety related systems. Its policies and procedures provide the most efficient means to minimize environmental impacts onsite and to the public. Certarus Brookings Decanting Station also continues to improve by implementing an incident investigation database to monitor potential risks of future incidents. The improvements made by Certarus Brookings Decanting Station, along with periodic review of current safety protocols, reduce the risk of future incidents.

Certarus Br

ny other employee whose job tasks are affected by a modification in process conditions are promptly made aware of and offered training to deal with the modification(s).

Pre-Startup Safety Review [PSSR] [40 CFR Part 68.77]
Pre-start up safety reviews related to new processes and modifications to existing processes are conducted routinely at Certarus Brookings Decanting Station. These reviews are conducted to confirm that construction, equipment, operating, and maintenance procedures are suitable for safe startup prior to placing equipment into operation.

Compliance Audits [40 CFR Part 68.79]
Certarus Brookings Decanting Station has protocols in place to conduct audits on a regular basis to determine whether the provisions set out under the US EPA RMP and OSHA PSM regulations are being implemented. These audits are planned to be conducted at least every 3 years, and any corrective actions required as a result of the audits are to be undertaken in a prompt manner.

Incident Investigation [40 CFR Part 68.81]
Certarus Brookings Decanting Station promptly investigates any incident that has resulted in or could reasonably result in a catastrophic release of a regulated substance. These investigations are undertaken to identify the situation leading to the incident as well as any corrective actions to prevent the release from reoccurring. All reports are retained for a minimum period of 5 years.

Employee Participation [40 CFR Part 68.83]
Certarus Brookings Decanting Station believes that Process Safety Management and accident prevention is a team effort. Employees are strongly encouraged to express their views concerning accident prevention issues and to recommend improvements. In addition, employees of Certarus Brookings Decanting Station have access to all information created as part of the facility's implementation of the RMP and PSM rules, including information resulting from Process Hazard Analyses in particular.

Hot Work Permit [40 CFR Part 68.85]
Certarus Brookin

describes the chemical hazards, operating parameters and equipment designs associated with all processes.

Process Hazard Analysis [40 CFR Part 68.67]
Comprehensive analyses ensure that hazards associated with our processes are identified and controlled efficiently. The methodology used to carry out these analyses is HazOp. The studies are undertaken by a team of qualified personnel with expertise in engineering and process operations and are revalidated at a regular interval of 5 years. Any findings related to the hazard analysis are addressed in a timely manner.

Written Operating Procedures [40 CFR Part 68.69]
To ensure safe operations, Certarus Brookings Decanting Station maintains detailed written operating procedures. The information is regularly reviewed and is readily accessible to operators involved in the processes.

Employee Training [40 CFR Part 68.71]
Certarus Brookings Decanting Station has a comprehensive training program in place to ensure that employees who are operating plant processes are competent in the applicable operating procedures. Refresher training is provided at least every three years and more frequently as needed.

Mechanical Integrity [40 CFR Part 68.73]
Certarus Brookings Decanting Station carries out documented maintenance checks on process equipment to ensure proper operations. Inspected process equipment include pressure vessels, piping systems, pressure relief and vent systems, emergency shutdown systems, controls, and pumps. Maintenance operations are carried out by qualified personnel with previous training in maintenance practices. Furthermore, these personnel are offered specialized training as needed. Any equipment deficiencies identified by the maintenance checks are corrected in a safe and timely manner.

Management of Change [MOC] [40 CFR Part 68.75]
Written procedures are in place at Certarus Brookings Decanting Station to manage changes in process chemicals, technology, equipment, and procedures. Facility operators or a

The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the stationary source [40 CFR 68.155(a)]:

Certarus is strongly committed to employee, public and environmental safety. This commitment is demonstrated by our comprehensive accidental release prevention program that encompasses design, installation, operating procedures, maintenance, and employee training. Robust engineering controls are in place to prevent possible releases of regulated substances. The Brookings facility is a non-responding facility for releases of the RMP-listed chemicals, so the site utilizes an Emergency Action Plan.

The stationary source and regulated substances handled [40 CFR 68.155(b)]:
The Brookings decanting station, operated by Certarus, serves as an injection hub where gas trailers from the surrounding farms are brought in and undergo several steps before being injected into the pipeline. The site is equipped with Pressure Reduction Systems (PRS) designed to adjust the pressure, ensuring alignment with the pipeline pressure.

Certarus Brookings Decanting Station is subject to U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) regulations outlined in Title 40 Code of Federal Regulations Part 68 (40 CFR 68), specifically the Chemical Accident Prevention Provisions. According to these regulations, Certarus Brookings Decanting Station is required to comply with the Risk Management Program (RMP) rule due to the quantity of methane stored onsite exceeding threshold quantities.

The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps [40 CFR 68.155(c)]:
Certarus Brookings Decanting Station has a program in place to comply with the provisions of the accidental release prevention regulations under 40 CFR Part 68. The following sections briefly describe the elements of the existing release prevention program.

Process Safety Information [40 CFR Part 68.65]
